titlestmt.titleproper: Tequila Mockingbird LA Punk Museum collection LSC.2375
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kelly Besser, 2020.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2024 February 21.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

did.unittitle: Tequila Mockingbird LA Punk Museum collection

physdesc.extent: (13 boxes, 2 flat boxes, 2 map case folders, and 1 shoe box)

did.abstract: Tequila Mockingbird is a writer, producer, singer, musician, and actress whose work is foundational to the Los Angeles underground. She created and helms the LA Punk Museum, an art experience comprised of a series of pop-up art and music events. She currently directs, produces, writes, and hosts Tequila TV, a public-access show in which she interviews musicians and artists. With a dedicated service to public access television for decades, Tequila has created several shows including New Wave Theater, the Dude Magazine TV Show, SCUM Southern California Music Television, and the Cocktail Hour. The Tequila Mockingbird LA Punk Museum collection ranges in date from 1976-2023 and contains U-Matic tapes from record labels for Tequila TV; VHS tapes from Dude TV, Tequila TV, and Van Gogh; an LA Punk Museum calendar and coffee mug; More Mayonnaise issues 4-7, Lost Anarchy issue 13; Bomb City and Duchess de Sade posters; and The Weirdos singer John Denney's jacket and pants.
did.physloc:
Portions of the collection stored off-site. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
Folder 17 and Folder 18 are stored onsite.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIO and AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Materials will require assessment and may need further processing for safe access. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright to portions of this collection has been assigned to the UCLA Library Special Collections. The library can grant permission to publish for materials to which it holds the copyright. All requests for permission to publish must be submitted in writing to Library Special Collections. Credit shall be given as follows: The Regents of the University of California on behalf of the UCLA Library Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Tequila Mockingbird LA Punk Museum collection (Collection 2375). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: These materials comprise a portion of the Tequila Mockingbird LA Punk Museum collection. Mockingbird stewards the rest of the collection for ongoing exhibitions and pop-up museum events.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Kelly Besser with assistance from Tess Livesley-O'Neil, 2020.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's Library Collections and Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tequila Mockingbird is a writer, producer, singer, musician, and actress whose work is foundational to the Los Angeles underground. She created and helms the LA Punk Museum, an art experience comprised of a series of pop-up art and music events. She currently directs, produces, writes, and hosts Tequila TV, a public-access show in which she interviews musicians and artists. With a dedicated service to public access television for decades, Tequila has created several shows including New Wave Theater, the Dude Magazine TV Show, SCUM Southern California Music Television, and the Cocktail Hour. Tequila has donated materials to Library Special Collections as part of the punk collecting effort; attended punk-related events on campus such as The Zine Explosion... Archived! A Ben is Dead 30th Anniversary Pre-party; presented at the UCLA Conference, Curating Resistance: Punk as Archival Method; and hosted the Library Special Collections punk collective at her own events such as the 7th Anniversary LA Punk Museum Festival. She spends her free time at home working on her autobiography with her Chihuahua, Regina.
Source: Biography written by Tequila Mockingbird (aka Taquila Mockingbird), Kelly Besser, and Allie Whalen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Tequila Mockingbird LA Punk Museum collection ranges in date from 1976-2023 and contains U-Matic tapes from record labels for Tequila TV; VHS tapes from Dude TV, Tequila TV, and Van Gogh; an LA Punk Museum calendar and coffee mug; More Mayonnaise issues 4-7, Lost Anarchy issue 13; Bomb City and Duchess de Sade posters; and The Weirdos singer John Denney's jacket and pants.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The existing order of the materials was maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains U-Matic footage of the following: Tequila TV Fashion, Idol Worship, Terri King, Pygme Love, Circus, Glowing Candles, Luna Stix, Scarlet Fry's Horrorama, Habitrol - Latest Advances in Smokeless Technology.

phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

Box contains two CDs: Tequila Mockingbird and the Blonde Moondust "Rockets of Desire" (2023) and 2022 Solstice "The Continual Return of Dr. Ordinaire (a postmodern dark wave rock opera).

did.unittitle: LA Punk Museum red foam mohawk

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jacket and pants designed and worn by Weirdo's singer John Denney. The jacket, signed by Denney and Nicky Beat, includes pins, duct tape, drawings of a drum set and guitar, a tic tac toe board, smiley faces, and the inscription, Fuck Happy.

did.unittitle: LA Punk Museum mug with safety pin handle
